1.title: United Negro College Fund
1.subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

1.title: Support the Equal Justice Initiative
1.subtitle: Your contribution is critical to efforts to end mass incarceration and excessive punishment in the United States, challenge racial and economic injustice, and protect the basic human rights for the most vulnerable people in American society.

1.title: American Civil Liberties Union
1.subtitle: Donate to the ACLU. The ACLU has been at the center of nearly every major civil liberties battle in the U.S. for over 100 years. This vital work depends on the support of ACLU members in all 50 states and beyond.

2.title: Revisionist History: Miss Buchanan’s Period of Adjustment
2.subtitle: Revisionist History is a podcast from Malcolm Gladwell and Pushkin Industries.In this episode: A landmark Supreme Court case. A civil rights revolution. Why has everyone forgotten what happened next?

products.name: Jubilee Ankara Face Mask with Nose Bridge

products.name: Oatmeal and Spice Moisturizing Body Bar

3.title: QuintesScential Candles
3.subtitle: Since we love burning scented candles, we decided to embark on our journey of becoming Black chandlers. We decided, from the beginning, to use only the healthiest ingredients in anything that we make and sell.

products.name: Earthy
products.description: Earthy is a sensual fragrance that lives up to its name. Our Earthy is aromatic, woodsy, and intoxicating, with a prominent sandalwood base, complemented by layers of sage, spice, and amber.

products.description: Ready for bed? Time to unwind from a hectic day? Escape with gentle notes of lavender on your pillow with the crisp scent of freshly washed linen.

products.name: Pleasantry
products.description: Our Pleasantry is a proven pleaser, combining a patented odor neutralizing technology with a crisp, clean fragrance that brings to mind fresh linens drying on the line. Pleasantry doesn't just cover up unwanted smells, it cancels them out.

3.title: Liberation Library
3.subtitle: Young people in the jails and prisons we serve are experiencing a loss of programming and in-person family visits, leading to further isolation during these uncertain times. We believe it is now more important than ever for incarcerated young people to have access to other worlds of their choosing.

4.title: Did you really just say that?
4.subtitle: Here's advice on how to confront microaggressions, whether you're a target, bystander or perpetrator

4.title: Not all Black people are African American. Here's the difference.
4.subtitle: Black Lives Matter protests have opened up conversations about the history of privilege, racism, and the lived experiences and identities of black people in America. Now, the distinction between "Black" and "African American" has become a prominent conversation on social media.

5.title: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund
5.subtitle: Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice in a society that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans. LDF also defends the gains and protections won over the past 75 years of civil rights struggle and works to improve the quality and diversity of judicial and executive appointments.

5.title: The Case for Reparations
5.subtitle: Two hundred fifty years of slavery. Ninety years of Jim Crow. Sixty years of separate but equal. Thirty-five years of racist housing policy. Until we reckon with our compounding moral debts, America will never be whole.

6.title: Covid-19’s Impact on People in Prison
6.subtitle: People who are incarcerated are at great risk of sickness and death as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic and more must be done to release people who are imprisoned and are not a threat to public safety or are elderly or infirm.

6.title: Black on Black
6.subtitle: Black On Black™ is beautifully designed clothing & accessories that are both clothing line AND protest sign. Black On Black™ is a social protest on clothing that De:Constructs the Construct.

products.name: "Anti-Racist Social Club" Throw Pillows
products.description: These cozy throw pillows feature high-quality fabric and prints that will upgrade your space. Zippered cover care instructions: machine wash in cold water using mild detergent and gentle cycle only, hang to dry.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T
products.description: Juneteenth is the oldest known celebration commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.  Dating back to 1865, it was on June 19th that the Union soldiers, led by Major General Gordon Granger, landed at Galveston, Texas with news that the war had ended and that the enslaved were now free.

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T

7.title: The Hate U Give
7.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

9.title: Justice for Julius Jones
9.subtitle: Julius Jones is on death row in Oklahoma, despite maintaining his innocence and compelling evidence that he was wrongfully convicted. Send an email to express your support of his release.

emailInfo.subject: Justice for Julius Jones
emailInfo.messageBody:
Dear Oklahoma Pardon & Parole Board members,

I strongly feel that Julius Darius Jones (# 270147) was wrongfully convicted of murder and sentenced to death in 2002. A crime for which he has always maintained his innocence.

Jones, a black 19 year old man, was arrested in 1999 for shooting white insurance executive Paul Scott Howell in Edmond, Oklahoma. At the time of his arrest, Julius was a successful athlete and honor student on scholarship at the University of Oklahoma.

Recently, new evidence of racial bias in the Jones’ case has been uncovered by the ABC documentary, “The Last Defense.”

One day after the documentary finale aired (7-25-18), the Oklahoma Criminal Court of Appeals released a document indicating they could take a look at the Jones’ case.

There are many factors that were overlooked and never presented during the Julius Jones trial.
1. Jones’ attorney during the trial was inexperienced by his own admission and this was his first death penalty case.
2. Several key pieces of evidence were never presented to the jury.
3. Tunnel vision set in and the police and prosecutor ignored evidence pointing to others as the shooter.
4. The court ignored an alleged racial statement made by one of the jurors
5. The jury judged Jones based on his race.
After viewing the recent ABC documentary, “The Last Defense,” I am even more convinced than ever of Julius’ innocence and that he should be given a new trial. I also ask that District Attorney David Prater release Julius Jones’ case files to his attorneys in order to promote public trust in both the criminal justice system and in Julius Jones’s case.

We all have all heard the phrase ‘beyond a shadow of doubt.’ To me, there is more than a shadow of doubt in this case.

Please, I ask that you do whatever is within your power to support Julius Jones’ Clemency Petition and see that this injustice – the wrongful conviction of Julius Jones – is overturned.

Thank you,
[Your Name]
[Your location]

11.title: Seeing White Podcast Series
11.subtitle: Just what is going on with white people? Police shootings of unarmed African Americans. Acts of domestic terrorism by white supremacists. The renewed embrace of raw, undisguised white-identity politics. Unending racial inequity in schools, housing, criminal justice, and hiring. Some of this feels new, but in truth it’s an old story.

13.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
13.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

13.title: Accountability in a Time of Justice
13.subtitle: Accountability is a well-worn word in social justice circles. We have worked hard to figure out what accountability means to us as we attempt to walk our social justice talk.

14.title: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
14.subtitle: An unforgettable true story about the potential for mercy to redeem us, and a clarion call to end mass incarceration in America — from one of the most inspiring lawyers of our time.

16.subtitle: Of the seven factors the researchers identified, perhaps the most insidious is passivism or passive racism, which includes an apathy toward systems of racial advantage or denial that those systems even exist.

18.title: Email for Tianna Arata
18.subtitle: Email San Luis Obispo District Attorney Dan Dow to demand that the charges against Tianna Arata are dropped

emailInfo.subject: We demand that all charges against Tianna Arata be dropped
emailInfo.messageBody:
Hi, my name is [Your name]

I am contacting you regarding the arrest of local leader and activist Tianna Arata. Tianna is an extremely brave young person who has put her body on the line for her community, peacefully protesting throughout the past weeks against systemic racism and white supremacy. Tianna has a long history of being an activist and has always advocated for those in marginalized communities in every aspect of her life.

The SLO protests have been extremely peaceful, and the night of her arrest was no different. On July 21, after the protest was winding down, Tianna was forcefully and violently arrested by six police officers. Witnesses say she was with friends, putting their stuff back into their cars. She was charged with five counts, including two felonies, one of which was inciting a riot. All reporting on this night of protests say it was extremely peaceful.

It is obvious that the city of SLO is violently targeting this leader of the local Black Lives Matter movement in an attempt to quell resistance to racism and oppression. She has never advocated for any sort of violence in her protests, for this reason exactly. Leaders, especially young Black women, are often targeted simply for standing up for their lives and rights, and trying to better their communities. It is abhorrent that SLO is participating in this display of state violence and white supremacy. Because of this, I demand that all charges be dropped against Tianna and she be returned to her family immediately.

Tianna is innocent. I stand with her and reaffirm that her life and freedom matters, as well as the lives of all Black SLO residents. Correct your mistakes. Listen to your people. Do better.

As of Monday, August 10th, the charges against Tianna have been increased to four felony counts of false imprisonment, one count of felony conspiracy, and three misdemeanors. Tianna faces up to FIFTEEN years in prison because of these ludicrous charges. Facing these charges and possibly being convicted is leading, and will lead to, devastating repercussions for Tianna. Already, she is dealing with extreme anxiety, harassment, feeling unsafe in her own home and community, and more. Her future will be destroyed. Her dreams will be squashed. She is a leader, a student, an extremely hard worker, a beacon of joy and light, an athlete, a creative, a daughter, and most of all a person. Again, these charges will destroy Tianna's life. Drop them immediately.

Sincerely,

[Your name]

She has organized many peaceful protests in the San Luis Obispo community.

They felt strongly that there’s no reason why these products are consistently being discovered when they should be household names. So, they said let’s create the place we want to shop.

21.title: Microaggressions Matter
21.subtitle: They may not always be ill-intentioned, but the slights illuminate deeper problems in America.

21.title: Email the mayor of Louisville
21.subtitle: Send a pre-filled email to Mayor Fischer of Louisville, KY to demand he holds the officers who killed Breonna Taylor accountable.

emailInfo.subject: Accountability for Breonna Taylor
emailInfo.messageBody:
Mayor Fischer,

Like thousands of people across the country, I was appalled to hear about Breonna Taylor's murder on March 13th. Echoing the requests of Louisville community organizers, the following demands must be met to ensure that the officers responsible for Breonna's death are held accountable for their brash, reprehensible actions:

  1. Your office and the Louisville City Council must address the use of force by the Louisville Metro Police
  2. The officers that killed Breonna (Sgt. Jonathan Mattingly, Detective Brett Hankison, and Detective Myles Cosgrove) must be fired, and have their pensions revoked
  3. Ensure that all necessary information is provided to a local, independent civilian community police accountability council
  4. Create policy for a transparent investigation process due to law enforcement misconduct
  5. Appoint a special prosecutor to bring forward charges against the officers and oversee all parts of this case

It is imperative that you condemn the actions of these officers. Raids cannot be performed with a shoot first, ask questions later mentality. Too many lives have been lost this way, and too often "danger" is determined by deeply entrenched racial biases, not actual threat level.

It is a tragedy that Breonna Taylor is not alive today. Police must be held to a higher standard than this. I trust that your office and the involved parties will do the right thing.

Sincerely,

[Your name] from [Your location]

22.title: How to be an Antiracist
22.subtitle: This conversation with professor Ibram X. Kendi was recorded during the 2019 Aspen Ideas Festival in Aspen, Colorado. In it, he explores what an antiracist society might look like, how we can play an active role in building it, and what being an antiracist in your own context might mean.

products.description: 2020 BLK & Bold Logo Dad Hat. Black/White/Yellow

28.title: Sweet Pea Books Inc
28.subtitle: Sweet Pea Books is dedicated to producing multicultural books that expose, inspire, amuse, and foster a love of reading in all children. Sweet Pea Books aims to promote the development of good character by teaching values through literature as well as expose young readers to different cultures.

products.name: D Is For Dragon Fruit (Hardcover)
products.description: D is for Dragon Fruit is a vibrantly illustrated, exotic fruit alphabet book that exposes children to a variety of nutritious fruits, reinforces the alphabet and expands a child’s knowledge of the world.

products.name: When Mama Braids My Hair (Hardcover)
products.description: When Mama Braids My Hair captures a young girl’s experience of having her hair braided and the bond it creates with her mother. The tradition of African hair braiding is more than just a Sunday routine. Come join Nikki on an adventure as she is transformed into an Egyptian queen, a Nigerian goddess, a Zulu warrior, and a Maasai girl.

products.name: Elephants Don't Have Stripes! (COMING SOON!)
products.description: Elephants Don’t Have Stripes! Deep in the valley, in the dry grasslands of the African savanna, a young elephant admires other animals for their beauty. He yearns to look and act more like them. One by one, each wish comes true and the young elephant couldn’t be happier.

28.title: Bailee's Nail Box
28.subtitle: Bailee's Nail Box is a FUN box for girls, created by 11 year old Bailee K. for girls ages 4 - 12 who love all things nails! Bailee's goal was to create memorable boxes filled with different tools for fun nail designs with an extra girly accessory with each box.

products.name: Bailee's Bundle
products.description: Two safe non-toxic polishes - Bailee's Spark & Rose Shimmer. Nail polish ring holder. All natural hand scrub, made by Bailee, that will leave your hands smooth, moisturized and exfoliated.

products.name: Christmas Scrunchie
products.description: We have a variety of different colored Christmas scrunchies! Let us send you one!

products.name: My Beauty Secret is Gratitude
products.description: You've now found the staple t-shirt of your wardrobe. It's made of a thicker, heavier cotton, but it's still soft and comfy. And the double stitching on the neckline and sleeves add more durability to what is sure to be a favorite!

28.title: VZN Clothing
28.subtitle: Our clothing is made to motivate you to visualize your goals and remain persistent through adversity. Vision is not simply seeing with the eyes, but rather creating a positive image and experience for your future success with your mind. By following your vision with action and remaining persistent through adversity, we believe anything is possible.

products.name: Spread Love, Not Germs Heart Mask
products.description: Black mask with red and white embroidery

products.name: Tre Balloon Series 1.0 Tee
products.description: For the Tre Series, we follow the boy, Tre, on his path of following his dreams. The purpose of Tre being lifted by the balloons while holding the basketball is to inspire people to work towards their goals with the confidence of a child who is following their dreams.

products.name: Memory Lane Poster Print
products.description: 8 x 11 in 80 lb paper Oil painting print with a matte finish

29.title: Nia the Loc God
29.subtitle: A natural oil that your hair will love. You are one step closer to moisturized, shiny, healthy hair that smells amazing.

products.name: Loc God Stimulating Oil 4oz
products.description: This stimulating oils is the perfect item to add to your haircare routine. 100% natural, also smells 100% like lemongrass essential oils.  This product is extremely light and will leave your scalp itch free.

products.name: The Loc God Hydration Mist 9oz
products.description: This hydration mist is the perfect item to add to your haircare routine. 100% natural, also smells 100% like lavender essential oils.  This product will leave your hair super soft and give you an extra boost of hydration and shine.

products.name: The Loc God Scalp Renewal Cleansing Shampoo (Lemongrass)
products.description: Deep cleansing shampoo, with a luxurious smell that will leave your hair clean and not feeling stripped. This shampoo is 100% natural. It will help with dandruff, irritated and or itchy scalp.

29.title: Puzzle Huddle
29.subtitle: Kids grow up fast! Stay connected and hear about new puzzle designs and discounts. We promise not to spam you because we're too busy with potty training and coloring books.

products.name: XL Chemistry Girl Kids' Puzzle
products.description: The XL Chemistry Girls' Puzzle was created to inspire and affirm children using a creative format. This puzzle measures 14n x 19.5in, includes 100 pieces, and is constructed from sturdy cardboard similar to most puzzles sold in stores. Depending on a child’s fine motor skills, the puzzle can be ideal toddlers or young children.

products.name: Future President - Oval Office
products.description: The Future President - Oval Office Puzzle measures 12in x 16.5in, includes 54 pieces, and is constructed from sturdy cardboard similar to most puzzles sold in stores. Depending on a child’s development and fine motor skills, this puzzle can be ideal toddlers or young children.

products.name: XL Noah's Ark Kids' Puzzle
products.description: The XL Noah's Ark Kids Puzzle was created to inspire and affirm children using a creative format. This puzzle measures 14in x 19.5in, includes 100 pieces, and is constructed from sturdy cardboard similar to most puzzles sold in stores. Depending on a child’s fine motor skills, the puzzle can be ideal toddlers or young children.

29.title: Coily and Cute
29.subtitle: Sharee has loved art all her life and has taken every opportunity to study it. She runs one of the Black-owned companies where customers can buy art prints.

products.name: Quarantine Sticker Sheet
products.description: Cute self-care, quarantine inspired sticker set. Decorate your planner, notebooks, or anything you want to stick a sticker on!

products.name: I Love My Hair Sticker
products.description: Looking for a cute sticker to show how much you love your hair? Well, look no further!

products.name: Naturalista Pin
products.description: Pop your collar and add some flair with this naturalista pin. Rose gold and black pin.

30.title: Puku
30.subtitle: Puku was founded in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy after experiencing the hardship of living without the power to charge phones. And just like the animal, it retains the same essential qualities such as Power, Beauty and Speed.

products.name: Puku Light - Charger
products.description: For the fashion-forward trendsetters who love technology and appreciate sleek design, Puku Light is a must-have portable charger to stay connected on the go.

products.name: Puku G8 - Earphones
products.description: Enjoy music on the go or make phone calls with these tangle-free and high-resolution in-ear headphones.

products.name: Puku 12S Pro - Charger
products.description: Traveling long distances or for long periods of time can be an arduous process, but thankfully, with Puku 12S, keeping all your mobile devices charged along the way doesn’t have to be.

30.title: Raycon
30.subtitle: Raycon is built around the mission that everyone deserves to enjoy great audio. We believe amazing audio experiences inspire go-getters around the world and power their everyday lives.

products.name: The Everyday E25 Earbuds
products.description: Our most compact wireless earbuds for your everyday grind. Designed to deliver more powerful sound than any earbuds of its size.

products.name: The Trendsetter H20 Headphones
products.description: Choose what you hear with superior noise cancellation that enhances sound quality while blocking outside distractions. Push the boundaries and find your flow with fully immersive surround sound.

products.name: The Runner's Belt
products.description: A nifty and lightweight belt to fuel your workouts. Hold your smartphone, Raycon earbuds, and other daily essentials for your run or gym sessions.

30.title: RayTec Audio
30.subtitle: RayTec, wherever you go, your soundtrack should follow. Music has changed the world. It's a form of expression and should be heard at the highest, premium level. When you hear music that you like, when you're listening to a book of your choosing, you get excited, or motivated or you may become active.

products.name: RayTec Airpods
products.description: Ideal for hands free activities: Exercising, phone calls, music, working, audio books, and tuning the world out!

products.name: RayTec Watch6 — Black Case
products.description: Make bluetooth calls through your watch for hands free communication. Read messages and notifications through this watch: Facebook, Instagram, Whatsapp and more.

products.name: RayTec-C10 Headphones
products.description: Comfy on the ears, Adjustable to fit on your head, Foldable, Chargeable, Super bass

31.title: Know Your Rights Camp
31.subtitle: Colin Kaepernick's organization's mission is to advance the liberation and well-being of Black and Brown communities through education, self-empowerment, mass-mobilization and the creation of new systems that elevate the next generation of change leaders.

31.title: Justice for Lakeith Smith
31.subtitle: Lakeith Smith, now 20, was charged with the murder of his friend, A’Donte Washington when he was only 15— a crime he did not commit. A'donte died at the hands of a policeman, after the police fired 4 rounds into him - and he currently walks free.
